name: radioButton
content:
Creates a radio button on the screen with the initial *checked* boolean value and referenced by the given *id* at default location (0,0). Only one radio button in a group can be selected at a time.

Some apps require the user to choose one item from a predefined group of options. Usually radio buttons are used for this. Any radio buttons without a group specified will be in the same default, unnamed group.

examples.name: Example: Radio Button Click Events
examples.description: Retrieve and display your favorite color, in a named group, each time a radio button is clicked.

examples.name: Example: Finding the Checked Item
examples.description: Iterate over the radio buttons in a group to determine which one is selected each time the favorite button is clicked.

palette_params.name: id
palette_params.description: The unique identifier for the screen element. Must begin with a letter, contain no spaces, and may contain letters, digits, - and _.

palette_params.name: group
palette_params.description: The group that the radio button is associated with. Only one button in a group can be checked at a time. Any radio buttons without a group specified will be in the same default, unnamed group.

palette_params.name: checked
palette_params.description: Whether the radio button is initially checked.

return_value: No return value. Modifies screen only.
short_description: Creates a radio button on the screen with the initial checked boolean value and referenced by the given id at default location (0,0). Only one radio button in a group can be selected at a time.
tips:
- If there is another UI element at location (0,0) the radio button is placed at the next available position to the right or below.
- There are various UI element modification functions available: `setText()`, `showElement()`, `hideElement()`, `deleteElement()`, `setPosition()`, `setSize()`. 
- There are various UI element query functions available: `getText()`, `getXPosition()`, `getYPosition()`.

- Radio buttons usually have an associated textLabel.
- If you are asking the user something with a single response, consider using a single checkbox screen element instead.
- The radio button can also be created in design mode.
